subtitle: A dessert that  looks stunning and tastes great.

method.text: Quickly spoon the strawberry and chocolate ice cream into 2 x 450 g / 11b loaf tins. Smooth the top and refreeze until solid.

Meanwhile, line a 1 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>2</sub> kg / 3Ib 2oz loaf tin with parchment paper. Soften <sup>3</sup>/<sub>4</sub> of the vanilla ice cream a little and line the side and base. Smooth with the back of a spoon and refreeze.

Cut the strawberry and chocolate ice cream in half lengthways with a hot, dry knife. Carefully, place a length of chocolate and strawberry ice cream to form a chequered pattern in the loaf tin. Top with alternating colours then cover with remaining vanilla ice cream. Refreeze.

To serve, invert onto a serving plate. Spoon the ice cream into a piping bag fitted with a star nozzle. Pipe three rows of cream on top of the ice cream and decorate with the raspberries. Serve in slices.

title: Chequered ice
